revised_title: Gordon Hindle Rawcliffe: A Life Dedicated to Electrical Engineering
tldr: Gordon Hindle Rawcliffe was a prominent Electrical Engineering professor at the University of Bristol, known for his work on the principle of Pole Amplitude Modulation (PAM) for induction motors. Despite facing challenges due to his bronchial asthma, Rawcliffe dedicated his life to the study of electrical machines and made significant contributions to the field.
